verses.plain: Hear the right, O LORD, attend unto my cry, give ear unto my prayer, that goeth not out of feigned lips.

tokens.t: Hear the right, O
, attend unto my cry, give ear unto my prayer,
not out of feigned lips.

verses.plain: Let my sentence come forth from thy presence; let thine eyes behold the things that are equal.

tokens.t: Let my sentence come forth from thy presence; let thine eyes behold the things that are equal.

verses.plain: Thou hast proved mine heart; thou hast visited me in the night; thou hast tried me, and shalt find nothing; I am purposed that my mouth shall not transgress.

tokens.t: Thou hast proved mine heart; thou hast visited
in the night; thou hast tried me,
shalt find nothing; I am purposed
my mouth shall not transgress.

verses.plain: Concerning the works of men, by the word of thy lips I have kept me from the paths of the destroyer.

tokens.t: Concerning the works of men, by the word of thy lips I have kept
the paths of the destroyer.

verses.plain: Hold up my goings in thy paths, that my footsteps slip not.

tokens.t: Hold up my goings in thy paths,
my footsteps slip not.

verses.plain: I have called upon thee, for thou wilt hear me, O God: incline thine ear unto me, and hear my speech.

tokens.t: I have called upon thee, for thou wilt hear me, O God: incline thine ear unto me,
my speech.

verses.plain: Shew thy marvellous lovingkindness, O thou that savest by thy right hand them which put their trust in thee from those that rise up against them.

tokens.t: Shew thy marvellous lovingkindness, O thou that savest by thy right hand them which put their trust
from those that rise up

verses.plain: Keep me as the apple of the eye, hide me under the shadow of thy wings,

tokens.t: Keep me as the apple of the eye, hide me under the shadow of thy wings,

verses.plain: From the wicked that oppress me, from my deadly enemies, who compass me about.

tokens.t: From the wicked that oppress me,
my deadly enemies,
compass me about.

verses.plain: They are inclosed in their own fat: with their mouth they speak proudly.

tokens.t: They are inclosed in their own fat: with their mouth they speak proudly.

verses.plain: They have now compassed us in our steps: they have set their eyes bowing down to the earth;

tokens.t: They have now compassed us in our steps: they have set their eyes bowing down to the earth;

verses.plain: Like as a lion that is greedy of his prey, and as it were a young lion lurking in secret places.

tokens.t: Like as a lion
is greedy of his prey, and as it were a young lion lurking in secret places.

verses.plain: Arise, O LORD, disappoint him, cast him down: deliver my soul from the wicked, which is thy sword:

tokens.t: Arise, O
, disappoint him, cast him down: deliver my soul from the wicked,
thy sword:

verses.plain: From men which are thy hand, O LORD, from men of the world, which have their portion in this life, and whose belly thou fillest with thy hid treasure: they are full of children, and leave the rest of their substance to their babes.

tokens.t: From men
thy hand, O
, from men of the world,
their portion in
life, and whose belly thou fillest with thy hid
they are full of children, and leave the rest of their
to their babes.

verses.plain: As for me, I will behold thy face in righteousness: I shall be satisfied, when I awake, with thy likeness.

tokens.t: As for me, I will behold thy face in righteousness: I shall be satisfied, when I awake, with thy likeness.

footnotes.text: not…: Heb. without lips of deceit
by thy…: or, them which trust in thee from those that rise up against thy right hand
my…: Heb. my enemies against the soul
Like…: Heb. The likeness of him (that is, of every one of them) is as a lion that desireth to ravin
they…: or, their children are full
